docs.snippet: North Koreans have gained unprecedented connectedness with greater access to media and devices like cellphones over Kim Jong Un's five-year rule. But private citizens' embrace of a state-controlled network has opened the way to unparalleled state ...
docs.lead_paragraph: North Koreans have gained unprecedented connectedness with greater access to media and devices like cellphones over Kim Jong Un's five-year rule. But private citizens' embrace of a state-controlled network has opened the way to unparalleled state censorship and surveillance in the long-isolated, totalitarian country.

headline.main: As North Koreans Use Phones, State Finds New Ways to Censor
headline.print_headline: As North Koreans Use Phones, State Finds New Ways to Censor

docs.snippet: Nigeria's upper house of parliament will investigate allegations the state oil company illegally inflated funds it collected from an official subsidy scheme to 5.1 trillion naira (13.8 billion pounds) between 2006 and 2015, lawmakers said on Wedne...
docs.lead_paragraph: Nigeria's upper house of parliament will investigate allegations the state oil company illegally inflated funds it collected from an official subsidy scheme to 5.1 trillion naira (13.8 billion pounds) between 2006 and 2015, lawmakers said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Nigerian Lawmakers to Investigate $17 Billion Subsidies Received by State Oil Firm
headline.print_headline: Nigerian Lawmakers to Investigate $17 Billion Subsidies Received by State Oil Firm

docs.snippet: The National Transportation Safety Board will look into the "man, the machine and the environment" as it investigates a plane crash that killed a former mayor and left the tail of the aircraft poking out of the roof of a condo building, officials ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The National Transportation Safety Board will look into the "man, the machine and the environment" as it investigates a plane crash that killed a former mayor and left the tail of the aircraft poking out of the roof of a condo building, officials said Wednesday.

headline.main: NTSB Launches Probe Into Plane Crash That Killed Ex-Mayor
headline.print_headline: NTSB Launches Probe Into Plane Crash That Killed Ex-Mayor

docs.snippet: A former CIA officer convicted of involvement in the 2003 kidnapping of an Egyptian cleric in Italy was released by authorities in Lisbon, Portugal on Wednesday after winning a last-minute reprieve from extradition....
docs.lead_paragraph: A former CIA officer convicted of involvement in the 2003 kidnapping of an Egyptian cleric in Italy was released by authorities in Lisbon, Portugal on Wednesday after winning a last-minute reprieve from extradition.

headline.main: Ex-CIA Spy Freed in Portugal, Avoids Extradition Over Kidnapping
headline.print_headline: Ex-CIA Spy Freed in Portugal, Avoids Extradition Over Kidnapping

docs.snippet: The U.S. Supreme Court on Wednesday told a lower court in a voting rights case to reassess whether Virginia's Republican-led legislature unlawfully tried to dilute the clout of black voters when it drew a series of state legislative districts....
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Supreme Court on Wednesday told a lower court in a voting rights case to reassess whether Virginia's Republican-led legislature unlawfully tried to dilute the clout of black voters when it drew a series of state legislative districts.

headline.main: U.S. Top Court Backs Review of Virginia Voting Districts in Race Case
headline.print_headline: U.S. Top Court Backs Review of Virginia Voting Districts in Race Case

docs.snippet: Bulgaria's interim Prime Minister Ognyan Gerdzhikov said on Wednesday his government wanted to apply formally to join the Exchange Rate Mechanism (ERM-2), commonly known as the euro "waiting room", before it hands over power....
